title: 690-F3
statement: F3. Tree of Life (hard)time limit per test8 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputTo add insult to injury, the zombies have taken all but two drawings from Heidi! Please help her recover the Tree of Life from only these two drawings.InputThe input format is the same as in the medium version, except that now the bound onnis2 ≤n≤ 1000and thatk= 2.OutputThe same as in the medium version.ExampleInput19 264 35 46 18 68 27 158 68 78 17 35 1OutputYES2 13 15 46 57 68 59 81 4

processed.result: Given a tree with $2 \le n \le 1000$ nodes, you are given two lists of node indices representing the edges of the tree.  Determine if the two lists together represent all the edges of the tree. If so, output "YES" followed by the list of nodes in a valid order.
You are given a list of numbers and two numbers representing a starting point and a target value.  You need to determine if you can find a subset of the numbers that add up to the target value.
